moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4: The French Defense. So far, so normal.
moves.2... c5: Krejcik makes it a mixture of the French and the Sicilian.
moves.3... Nf6: Attacking the base of the Pawn chain.
moves.4. f3: Supporting the Pawns, but exposing the K!-KR4 diagonal.
moves.4... Nxe4: Krejcik makes a sacrifice to get at Ziegelmeyer's exposed King.
moves.8... Nc6+: Ziegelmeyer graciously resigns before he can get mated.
